summary: Mobile app/web app concept that aims to detect child (under 13) phone use/touch, identify the child (potentially via biometrics), and trigger an alert/ringing, with the new requirement to store biometric data and/or touch-sensing data.
architectural_notes: Use device biometric authentication/face recognition capabilities (where available) to identify the child and trigger an audible alert when detected.

If biometric or touch-sensing data must be stored, define what data is collected, where it is stored (on-device vs backend), how it is encrypted, retention/deletion policy, and consent/guardian controls.

When capturing/storing touch-sensing data in the web app, persist only raw numeric touch event fields available via browser APIs (e.g., x/y, pressure, radiusX/radiusY, rotationAngle), not text descriptions.
Domain/name must be 5–50 characters and contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens (no spaces/parentheses).
known_issues: Biometric identification for children and apps targeting under-13 may have significant platform/policy/privacy constraints; requirements may need adjustment based on OS capabilities and child privacy regulations.

Storing biometric data and/or raw touch-sensing data for under-13 users is likely to be prohibited or heavily restricted by platform policies and child privacy laws; may require major scope change and legal/compliance review (or redesign to avoid storing such data).
Domain assignment/validation failing due to invalid characters/length in proposed domain names; must conform to 5–50 chars and letters/numbers/hyphens only.

existing_features.title: Build a web app that triggers a loud on-screen alarm/ringing state when a child accesses the app, and logs each access event (timestamp + identified child profile) for a parent/guardian to review.

Implement identity recognition using Internet Identity (WebAuthn) as the authentication mechanism, and map authenticated principals to child profiles created by the guardian (no collection or storage of biometric data).
Provide a guardian dashboard to manage child profiles (create, rename, archive) and link/unlink each profile to an Internet Identity principal.
Add a guardian-only control to stop/acknowledge an active alarm using a simple guardian PIN stored securely in backend state (hashed) and verified server-side.
Define a clear, consistent visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, layout) suitable for a safety/alert product, avoiding blue/purple as primary colors, and apply it across all screens.
Create core screens in the React UI: (1) Landing/sign-in, (2) Guardian dashboard (profiles + logs), (3) Alarm screen/state, and wire them to backend APIs with React Query.

Add an in-app “Limitations & Privacy” page in English that explains: this is a web app, it cannot detect raw phone touches, it does not collect biometrics, and it is intended for guardian-managed use for children under 13.

Generate and include required static images (icon + simple illustration) in the frontend and use them in the UI (e.g., app icon in header, illustration on landing). Store them under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Implement frontend UI in the Guardian Dashboard to manage stored biometric/touch-sensing data per child profile, including adding a new record, listing existing records, and deleting records (guardian-only).

Update user-facing copy to remove existing claims that the app does not collect/store biometric data, and instead accurately describe what biometric/touch-sensing data is stored, who can manage it, and the web-app limitations around device-level touch detection.

Update the Guardian Dashboard “Biometric & Touch-Sensing Records” UI so adding a touch-sensing record captures real touch/pointer events from an on-screen capture area and submits only numeric samples to the backend (no free-text input for touch-sensing).

Update user-facing copy to accurately describe that touch-sensing records are captured as raw numeric touch samples from interactions inside the web app, and remove/replace any remaining text-representation wording for touch-sensing data (including on the Limitations & Privacy page and the records manager dialog).

Add a production publishing checklist and deployment steps document that explains how to deploy the backend canister and the frontend assets to the Internet Computer, including how to configure a custom domain and the exact domain slug constraints (5–50 chars; letters, numbers, hyphens only).
Update user-facing app metadata to reflect the new app name "Child Access Control" consistently where it appears in the UI and page metadata, without using invalid domain characters.

Ensure the frontend routing and asset paths work correctly when the app is served from a custom domain over HTTPS, including direct navigation to routes like /dashboard, /alarm, and /limitations and loading generated assets from /assets/generated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build an app that detects when a child (under 13) touches/uses the phone, identifies the child via biometrics, and rings/alerts on detection.
Implement Motoko backend APIs and stable storage for: guardian PIN hash, child profiles, principal-to-profile links, and access/alarm event logs.
Store biometric data and/or touch-sensing data for the child to support identification/detection.

Add backend data models and stable-state storage to associate "biometric data" and/or "touch-sensing data" records with a specific child profile, with guardian-only authorization for create/read/delete operations.
Record and store raw numeric touch sensor samples provided by the browser (e.g., x/y, pressure, radiusX/radiusY, rotationAngle) rather than any text representation/notes.

Update the backend data model and Candid interface so touch-sensing records can be stored as structured raw numeric touch samples (e.g., x, y, pressure, radiusX, radiusY, rotationAngle, and a timestamp), rather than storing touch data as text encoded into bytes.

Update existing backend biometric record behavior to remain compatible with the current UI’s record list (record id, childId, timestamp, and a way to determine record type), while clearly distinguishing between biometric blob records and touch-sensing numeric-sample records.
